idea-plugin.name: AliasImports
idea-plugin.description:
Auto import libraries as their conventional aliases, such as numpy as np, os.path as osp, matplotlib.pyplot as plt, tensorflow as tf, etc. Just type in "np." in pycharm, and the "import numpy as np" is inserted automatically on the top of the script. This aliases can be customized by editing ~/.cache/map.json.
NOTE: THIS PLUGIN ASSUMES THAT YOUR IMPORTS ARE ON THE TOP OF ANY OTHER CODES.
NOTE: YOU HAVE TO RESTART YOUR IDE AFTER CUSTOMIZING THE CONFIG FILE.
idea-plugin.change-notes:
v1.0: By default, there are "numpy->np, tensorflow->tf, pandas->pd, os.path->osp, matplotlib.pyplot->plt" in the config file.
v1.1: Fix empty line bug.
v1.2: Fix bugs in comment line, python console and variable evaluator.
v1.3: Add compatibility to PyCharm Edu and PyCharm Community.
v1.4: Add support to the block comments on the top the script.
